page.title: 18The year l945 remembered (1)
page.content: {Mrs Vera Jordan,who was 15 in 1945, {was interviewed by children: } {Were you at school in 1945? No, I left school at 14- we only came to this school (now primary) unless we passed our 11+. At 14 I started work and all for 50p a week (it was 10 shillings in those days). It was housework and I used to wear a blue dress with an apron that had long pieces at the back and we had to wear stockings- we had no tights then- it was stockings and brown shoes or black. {What sort of things did you eat? Food was rather plain because we had only so much meat for a week, so much butter, jam, one egg and even bread was rationed. A loaf use to cost fourpence ha'penny- that's 2p.
